fields.description:
If an external user is removed from any group that contains can-use permission, they should not be counted toward license.

However, if that same external user has an underlying hibernate (local) user that does belong in a can-use provisioned group, then the that user is still counted toward license count.

A work around to this problem is to back up your database, and manually remove this user from the can-use provisioned group in the local-members table by deleting the relationship between the user and the group.  If you remove the user from all the can-use groups, the license count is decremented.
fields.summary: Users that have LDAP entities that do not belong in a can-use group are counted toward license if an underlying local member of the same name is in can use group
Allow users to add their favourite macros to the toolbar/dropdown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14815].
  {panel}

If images are too large to fit into PDF page, they are not scaled down. Currently xsl-fo transformation includes only 96 dpi to 72 dpi scaling. It assumes that image will fit to page in any case. But after this scaling this doesn't mean that image still will fit to page. It is possible to use "scale-down-to-fit" value of content-width and content-height attributes. The below patch scales down image if needed to fit PDF page. Of course 96 dpi to 72 dpi scaling is not performed in this case.

{code:xml}
        <!-- If no size parameters are specified, scale the image by width to fit -->
        <xsl:if test="not(@width) and not(@height)">
            <!-- scale the image itself
            <xsl:attribute name="content-width">75%</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="content-height">75%</xsl:attribute>
            -->
            <!-- isn't it easier to specify just scale-down-to-fit if needed? -->
            <xsl:attribute name="content-width">scale-down-to-fit</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="content-height">scale-down-to-fit</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="width">100%</xsl:attribute>
            <xsl:attribute name="height">100%</xsl:attribute>
        </xsl:if>
{code}
fields.summary: Image size handling in PDF exports

fields.description:
The renderer that generates slides for the flash applet for the {viewfile} macro generates a large amount of garbage.

This causes the VM to do 3.5-3.8 seconds of GC every 4 seconds, leading to an unusable application.
fields.summary: pdf {viewfile} slide renderer creates vast amounts of garbage which lead to poor performance

fields.description:
I'm trying to switch to OpenJDK 6 because it is the supported JDK at my company.  However, confluence won't start up because it tries to use the Java 2D class com.sun.image.codec.jpeg.JPEGImageEncoder.   Sun hasn't open sourced this class, so it's not available in OpenJDK.

See the log file snippet attached.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't start up on OpenJDK because it requires com.sun.image.codec.jpeg.JPEGImageEncoder

fields.description:
When multiple users try to add new pages at the same time, Confluence will throw an exception as seen below. This was discovered during stress testing, but was quite easy to replicate, but may or may not be enountered that frequently in a live instance (depending on practices for adding pages simultaneously). Here are the steps used to reproduce the error.

# Install Confluence 2.10.1 (likely happens on other versions as well, we tested on 2.10.1) against SQL Server 2005
# Add the transaction isolation and content table index described in Known Issues for SQL Server
# Multiple (we used 4.  3 or more should work) unique users each add a unique new page under the same node.
# All users clicked "Save" at the same time.

All but one of the users get the following error page thrown by docreatepage.action:

fields.description:
Pages edited under a prior version could have blank lines between items of a numbered list, by typing a SHIFT-ENTER key combination, then a SPACE character, then an ordinary ENTER to get the next item.  The numbering was properly continuous.

Now, as soon as any of those are edited, the blank lines are still preserved, but all items are numbered "1".

Having blank lines between items should continue to be an available option.  It greatly improves readability when the list includes any items long enough to wrap and give hanging indents.  Technical support step-by-step instructions routinely involve one or more extended items.
fields.summary: Bulleted lists in the WYSIWYG Editor can no longer have blank lines between items
Expressions like {0}, {*} inside pre-format blocks get wrongly interpreted as macros, but normal escaping doesn't work

fields.description:
The encoding test should use a GET to better replicate the situation with search, which changed to use a GET in 2.8 (I think).

This would correctly show up problems in the application server's URL encoding, like we have documented here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Application+Server+URL+encoding
fields.summary: Encoding test should use a GET submission to mimic quick search
Deleting an archived email with an attachment does not delete the attachment

fields.description:
I've encountered some similar bugs with macros that are generating links to others pages.

Since these issues are already documented on the plugin's page, I'll just refer to them :

* http://jira.adaptavist.com/browse/LINK-139
* http://jira.adaptavist.com/browse/SCAFF-106
* http://jira.adaptavist.com/browse/LINK-107

So it is said in LINK-139 that this is a limitation of Confluence. Is it really the case? Also, we have a license for Confluence and we are running 2.5.2 and no such problems occur. This is a blocker issue for migrating to newer versions. Even though this is a blocker here (we use lots of scaffolding forms generating links) it might not be the case generally, so I've put the priority to "Critical".
fields.summary: Links are not picked up in incoming/outgoing links by some links-generating macros

fields.description:
I was trying to figure out how to allow someone to edit a page in my personal space. In the permissions tab there were four options: Create, Export, Restrict and Remove. Hmmm, but I just want to allow someone to EDIT an existing page. After a series of trial and error I figured out the "Create" granted Edit permissions on existing pages. 

Man, that was a really complicated experience for such a seemingly simple task. I would have saved me 20 minutes if the label had just said "Create / Edit" rather than just "Create." I'd imagine the same goes for other objects like News, Comments and Attachments.
fields.summary: "Create" label for Space permissions should actually be "Create/Edit"
downloadallattachments.action maybe has error, the download zip file can't extract files.
Support other languages in the Did You Mean feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14767].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence embeds a missing image as a placeholder for movies and missing images.  I assume it used to be in the product and just got accidentally deleted at some stage.

I'm about to fix it to link to /icons/attachments/image.gif which is a very small image which we use as the icon for image attachments in the attachments screen etc.

We need a better image.  Preferably something reasonably large (eg 64px) that looks good at a wide variety of sizes and aspect ratios.

After discussion with Stephen, it would be much better to have different placeholder images for movies and for missing images.  This will require a fix to renderer and will not fit into 3.0.
fields.summary: Good placeholder images required for movie files and missing images
Groups with capital letter can't be created

fields.description:
Use the {calendar} macro on a page.

Export to PDF++

The exported page will show the calendar, but will also show:
* the entire contents of the dropdowns for month and for year
* the icon for 'Add a New Event'
* A loading symbol and 'Please Wait' message
fields.summary: Calendar macro does not work well with the new PDF export

fields.description:
Use the jiraissues macro on a page, e.g.:

{noformat}{jiraissues:anonymous=true|url=http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&query=jiraissues&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10470&tempMax=10|columns=type;key;summary}{noformat}


Only 10 results are shown at a time, and the user can page through to see more.

Export to PDF++.

The exported content will show only the 10 issues from the first page of results.

This could lead to confusion - I would expect the exported content to show all results.

Note that no matter which page of results the user has showing when doing the export, it will always be Page 1 contents which are shown in the export.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro will only contain the first page of results after exporting to PDF
Column/Section macros do not work correctly with the new PDF export

Seems to only occur in 3.0.

To reproduce, add any GIF image and tick 'Thumbnail'. Now click on it in IE (6 or 7). Boom! (although you can still navigate to it)
fields.summary: Clicking thumbnail in IE results in Runtime Error

fields.description:
Use the following markup on a page:
{code}text
{noformat}><script>alert('XSS')</script><b a=a{noformat}{code}


On another page in the same space, use the {index} macro. When this page is loaded by a user, the script will run.


See [here|http://qa-cac.atlassian.com/display/SEC/Page+Index] for a working example on QA-CAC.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability can be exploited with the Page Index macro
Email a link to a page's attachment

fields.description:
Steps for replication:
1) In the rich-text mode, add a heading, by selecting the format type from the drop down.
2) Press enter, and notice that the heading is still selected, as compared to FireFox where it changes to "Paragraph"
3) Create a table from the tool bar
4) Populate with some data and switch to the wiki-markup mode
5) Notice that the table is lost, the content is still present.
The wiki-markup is:
{noformat}
h2. test

h2. 1212
{noformat}
instead of
{noformat}
h2. test

|| 1 || 2\\ ||
| 1\\ | 2\\ |
{noformat}

As a workaround, please ensure the format is selected as "Paragraph" before inserting the table.
fields.summary: in IE, a table following immediately after a heading, is lost when switching to wiki-markup mode

fields.description: These issues should have been documented when 2.9 was released. It's apparently still a source of support requests, so it should be documented on CAC (and I can't find it anywhere).

fields.description:
Edit an attachment on a Confluence page.

You can move the attachment by specifying the page you want to move it to.

Enter a page name which does not exist - the following user error will appear:

{quote}You can not move the attachment to a non existing page. Please make sure that the choosen page exists in the selected space. {quote}

Problems:
# There ain't no such word as choosen
# The message as a whole is not well written, and is slightly confusing

fields.summary: Exessive logging during export word page

fields.description:
Under certain situations moving a page between spaces can change the links for the incorrect page in the current space.

To reproduce:
1) In space A, have two pages maybe ASDF and another called QWERTY
2) Have links to QWERTY from a few locations on other pages in Space A and other spaces
3) Edit ASDF and move it to Space B renaming it QWERTY
4) All links to Space A's QWERTY will now shift to Space B QWERTY

We would expect no changes in the links unless they were linked to ASDF in space A.  We never did check what happened for these.  The end result requires a bit of manipulation to resolve without manually fixing all the links that were modified.

We understand this is a bit unusual and appears contrived, but we happened to note this behavior in determining how duplicate pages were created in one of our spaces.   We found that the Edit action does validate the target space correctly for duplicates, but this behavior can occur under the right conditions.
fields.summary: Moving a page between spaces can change the links for the incorrect page under some circumstances

fields.description: If you have a user who is associated with 50 or so LDAP groups, when you go to the Edit User Groups page (Admin > Manage Users > Pick A user > Edit Groups) you will not be able to see the option to Leave local groups if you are using IE7.  The screen formats and adjusts properly under IE6 and Firefox.
fields.summary: Unable to edit user groups in IE7
Feature Request Plug-in Repository Test Button

fields.description: The Safari 4.0 Beta browser does not show the Rich Text Editor as an option when a user goes to edit a page. Safari 3 works great.
fields.summary: Safari 4 Beta - No Rich Text Editor
List of pages older then xyz data
when creating page with a table in wikimarkup and after saving the page in richtext, the table are broken

fields.description:
We are using a lot of thumbnails, and we've noticed that IE has the annoying habit of prompting for 'open or download' whenever we click a thumbnail with a gif image. Jpeg images seem to work properly. I realize this is an IE only issue, but since everyone in our company uses IE (company policy) this is a big problem for us.

I believe a possible solution for this could be: instead of linking directly to the image you could link to a very simple html page with the image on it.
fields.summary: Clicking on thumbnail images in IE prompts for download instead of opening popup with large image

fields.description:
When editing a table in the Rich Text editor using Internet Explorer 7, if you add a table row, you cannot select that row until you have saved the page.  This makes it painful to paste content into a table, as you can't select the new empty row until you save the page and edit it again.

Steps to reproduce (in Internet Explorer 7):
# Edit a page containing a table
# highlight an entire row and copy it
# Save or cancel
# Edit another page that contains a table with the same number of columns
# Use the "add row below" button to add a row
# Attempt to select the new row (you shouldn't be able to)
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# You can now select the empty row and paste the content in

There is a similar problem in Firefox 3.0.6 on both Mac and Windows.  If you create a new row, you can only select it by clicking in the right-most cell and dragging to the left.  If you click in the left-most cell and drag to the right, only the left-most cell is selected (the text outlined and the table cell bordered in blue).

All of my tests were conducted using a table with two columns.
fields.summary: Cannot select added table rows

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Insert a table
# Hit enter after the table
# A new line will be added at the top of the page, bringing the whole content one line down

This happens in Firefox 2. Firefox 3, IE7 are not affected.
This happens in Default Theme, Clickr Theme and Left Navigation Theme
fields.summary: Hitting enter after a table in RTE will add a new line at the top - Firefox 2 only

fields.description:
The Rich Text Editor adds an additional line after headings. In IE those lines are not handled correctly.

In IE (7) and FF (3)
* Open a new page. Edit with Rich Text Editor
* Add a first line with style Heading, press Enter.
* Add another line with style paragraph (I don't have the english name by hand, it's the standard style)
* Switch to WikiMarkup.
* You notice a blank line between the heading and the first line

In IE(7)
* Switch back to Rich Text.
* Write some text in the empty line and switch back to WikiMarkup.
* The text disapear 
The Text disapeared


Note: replicated in Firefox
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor adds an additional line after headings
Use different index fields for excerpts and the general text to search

fields.description:
[This page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-ComparingtheSystemAdministratorwiththeConfluenceAdministratorPermission] provides a list of what sys-admins can do versus what conf-admins can do.

There are several settings available to sys-admins only which are not yet listed, including [this new one|CONF-14199]
fields.summary: Global Permissions Page needs updating with several new settings available to System Administrators

select a template like the one below:

fields.description:
To replicate the issue:
# In a space that is accessible to anonymous users, attach image to a page
# Link the image to a page that does not exist:
{code}
[!image.png!|NonExistentPage]
{code}
# The image will be rendered for Confluence Users but broken to the anon. users.

Anonymous user should still be able to see the image as is the case with normal confluence-users.
fields.summary: Image is broken for anonymous user if the image attachment is linked to a page that does not exist

fields.description:
I've noticed > 10,000 errors of the form:

{code}
009-02-10 19:42:20,326 ERROR [TP-Processor22] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /plugins/feedburner/popularitemsfeed.action | userName: anonymous
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.feedburner.PopularItemsFeedAction.execute(PopularItemsFeedAction.java:33)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
{code}

on CAC. It looks like the [Feedburner Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/FeedBurner+Plugin] hasn't been updated for a while, the source link http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/confluence/feedburner-plugin/tags/1.0 no longer works.

See http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFMON/atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher.sendError for (slightly) more detail.
fields.summary: Feedburner Plugin  - NullPointerException in PopularItemsFeedAction

fields.description:
We're using Kerberos, and so the "/" is required to define the realm of our users.

However, when a user with a "/" in their username goes to create a personal space, they get a Confluence "page not found" page. For example, for a user name of "asdf/realm" would have this link to their personal space: https://bw-wiki.ncsa.uiuc.edu/display/~asdf/realm

If I manually point the browser to the correctly escaped link: "https://bw-wiki.ncsa.uiuc.edu/display/~asdf%2frealm" I get an apache "Not Found" error.

The link that is automatically generated by confluence is: https://bw-wiki.ncsa.uiuc.edu/display/~asdf%202frealm
Which is doubly escaping the "/", once to get to %2f, and then to %202f to escape the percent sign.

Please check where you're escaping your characters. Also, is it possible, even after proper escaping, to have a personal space for users with "/" in their usernames?
fields.summary: Users with "/" in their names are unable to create personal spaces

fields.description:
When the pages in a space are sorted into alphabetical order using the blue "A" link on listpages-dirview.action, new pages are not added in the appropriate order.

Steps to reproduce:
# Navigate to a space containing a few pages
# Open the "Pages" Link under "Browse Space" (or the "Browse" menu, depending on your theme)
# Drag and drop a page into a different place in the list (i.e. upset the current order)
# Click the blue "A" to order the pages alphabetically
# Navigate to the space home page
# Add a new page named so that it should not be last alphabetically
# Open the "Pages" Link again

The page will be listed at the end (i.e. the existing pages are sorted alphabetically, but new pages are added at the end in the order created).  The expectation would be that the new page would assume its place in the alphabetical order.  The default behavior in 2.8 and earlier was to sort pages in alphabetic order.  The blue "A" link appears to give users the ability to emulate the old behavior, but it only works if they resort the list of pages each time they add a new page.
fields.summary: New child pages are not sorted in the order specified for the space...

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14675].
  {panel}

Edit a confluence page in Word, save the word document back to Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Many users are used to the word "symbol" rather than "custom character".

Encountered during user sessions

h3. Fix

Change it to "symbol".

h3. Reason for severity.

Frequently encountered during user sessions.
fields.summary: Change the phrase "custom character" to "symbol"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14673].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Currently, changing the text colour requires the use of a drop down. Adding emoticons, among other things, brings up a popup window. Popup windows are generally less usable than drop downs - if someone changes tabs and then comes back to the Confluence tab, the popup window has disappeared. It takes a while to find it again.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Put add table, emoticons and custom characters into drop downs. If this is not appropriate, put them into dialog boxes.

h3. Reason for severity

Pop-up window problems were frequently encountered during user sessions.
fields.summary: In the RTE, some options are in less-usable pop-up windows when they could be in drop-downs.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Deleting and moving horizontal rules is difficult for some users.

Observed during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Give users the ability to select the horizontal rule so they can delete and move it to a different position with more ease.

h3. Reason for severity

The source of some user frustration.
fields.summary: In the RTE, Horizontal rules are difficult to delete and move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14668].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

The functionality isn't made clear enough. When dragging and dropping, the only feedback is the cursor moving to a different line location. This often goes without being noticed and some users don't even think that dragging and dropping is possible.

Observed during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Use similar feedback to the Dashboards UI.

h3. Reason for severity

Makes it harder for users to organise their page how they would like to. Some users were observed to give up entirely.
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping images in the RTE has insubstantial feedback

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Mac users keyboard shortcuts aren't supported in the RTE. When they try to do it, the appropriate action doesn't happen. They often then assume that this functionality isn't available.

Example: Users use Command + Z to undo something. This doesn't map to the RTE Ctrl+C so when it comes to undoing tables, the control doesn't work.

Discovered during user sessions.

h3. Fix

Using Javascript, map the shortcut controls to key combinations that Mac Users are used to. Ensure that the tooltip text reflects this.

h3. Reason for priority

This is a commonly encountered problem with Mac Users and a source of user frustration.
fields.summary: In the RTE, Shortcut keys aren't intuitive for Mac users

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14664].
  {panel}

There have been customer questions about whether it is possible to customise the PDF header and footer with dependence on the user language.

One customer is told [on this CAC page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customise+Adobe+PDF+Exports?focusedCommentId=180292149#comment-180292149] and [this CAC page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Create+PDF+in+another+language?focusedCommentId=180291840#comment-180291840] that it is not possible to do that.

Another customer is told in [this forum post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257300339&tstart=0#257300339] that it is possible.

We should confirm the correct answer, and provide it in the FAQs, and link the existing questions to it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14655].
  {panel}

Currently confluence controls the visibility of email addresses for all accounts in the "General Configuration" section. 
While this is a good thing to have, I think a user should be allowed to change that policy for his own email address.  
I would expect to find an option in the user profile section saying:

Email visibility:  [visible] [obfuscated] [hidden]  that would allow the user to override the system-wide setting.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Allow individual users to control the visibility mode of their email address

fields.description:
We recently moved from Confluence 2.6 to 2.10, and noticed that the location of the labels has shifted from the top of the page to the bottom in the Default Theme.

While this is a simple thing to switch back in the Layout options for the spaces, I wanted to drop a vote in for considering moving them back to the top of the page by default.

I know there's an open issue at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14473 around improving visibility of labels, but it seems like labels should be lightweight enough to not distract from page content if at the top of the page, and having them in between body content and children/comments makes them difficult enough to find when scrolling down through the page that it reduces usability.

Was there a reason to switch them to the bottom of the page?

Just my 2 cents.
fields.summary: Label location in Confluence 2.10 less optimal than in 2.6

fields.description: Every time Hibernate loads objects from the database it tries to put them into the cache. For example when Hibernate lazy loads collections it might end up loading objects from the database that are already in the cache anyway. This leads to a big overhead in a clustered environment, because all those puts need to be distributed across the cluster. But we can avoid the put() if we check with a lockless get() if the object is already in the cache. If it is there is no need update it because updates are not handled by calling put(), but by calling afterInsert() or afterUpdate() on the CoherenceCacheStrategy.
fields.summary: Improve cluster performance by avoiding cache puts for already-cached objects
